title: Required components should accept constant and enum values of the appropriate type

labels.name: C-Usability
labels.description: A targeted quality-of-life change that makes Bevy easier to use

labels.name: S-Needs-Design
labels.description: This issue requires design work to think about how it would best be accomplished

labels.name: X-Uncontroversial
labels.description: This work is generally agreed upon

labels.name: D-Straightforward
labels.description: Simple bug fixes and API improvements, docs, test and examples

body:
## What problem does this solve or what need does it fill?

When defining a component, we can specify that certain other components are required. Ordinarily, this inserts them with their default value.

```rust
#[derive(Component)]
#[require(
    LockedAxes(||LockedAxes::ROTATION_LOCKED),
)]
pub struct CharacterController;
```

If we want to override that, we can pass any function which takes no argument, and returns the appropriate component type.

```rust
#[derive(Component)]
#[require(
    LockedAxes(||LockedAxes::ROTATION_LOCKED),
)]
pub struct CharacterController;
```

However, this is verbose / frustrating when working with constants.

## What solution would you like?

Users should be able to pass in a constant, like so:

```rust
#[derive(Component)]
#[require(
  LockedAxes::ROTATION_LOCKED,
)]
pub struct CharacterController;
```

I suspect that we'll need to generate a closure that constructs the constant, but I haven't looked closely at the code here. We will need to require `Clone` unless we're storing a closure.

## What alternative(s) have you considered?

If, for macro reasons, we absolutely need to pass in the type before the constructor, we could do:

```rust
#[derive(Component)]
#[require(
    LockedAxes(LockedAxes::ROTATION_LOCKED),
)]
pub struct CharacterController;
```

## Additional context

We might also want to provide helpers for doing this for dynamically registered components.
